Headline: End Tax Lien Sale System
Short description: Abolishes the tax lien sale system that sells homeowner debt to private investors.
Description:
• The administration halts the tax lien sale on Day One, ending the sale of municipal tax debt to investor-backed private trusts.

• A new city-run tax collection system is established to give homeowners additional opportunities to enter into payment plans and pay down arrears.

• The administration works with the City Council to permanently abolish the tax lien sale system to keep homeowners in their homes.
SEO tags: tax lien sale, foreclosure prevention, debt collection, homeowners, finance

Headline: Advocate for a State Mortgage Recording Tax Exemption
Short description: Calls for a state exemption from the mortgage recording tax for certain first-time homebuyers.
Description:
• The Mamdani administration would advocate for a mortgage recording tax exemption for low- and middle-income first-time homebuyers.

• The mortgage recording tax currently ranges from 50 cents to $1 per $100 of mortgage financing.

• Implementing the exemption would require changes to state law governing the mortgage recording tax.
SEO tags: mortgage tax, homeownership, tax exemption, first-time buyers, affordability
Geli: no sources, instead dates got shifted to sources cell

Headline: Create City-Run Grocery Stores
Short description: Launches a pilot program of city-run grocery stores aimed at lowering food prices.
Description:
• As candidate, Mayor Mamdani said he would create a pilot network of city-owned grocery stores, with one location in each borough, to sell food at lower prices.

• He said the stores would operate with lower overhead by avoiding rent and property taxes, buying and selling at wholesale prices, and centralizing warehousing and distribution.

• In a CNN interview, Mamdani said the pilot would cost about $60 million and could be funded by redirecting existing city subsidies currently used to support private grocery operators.
SEO tags: public grocery, food security, affordability, pilot program, city-run

Headline: Ban Hidden and 'Junk' Fees
Short description: Prohibits hidden fees in consumer transactions through new legislation.
Description:
• Mayor Mamdani said he would advocate for city and state legislation banning hidden “junk fees” that are not disclosed upfront to consumers.

• The proposal targets surprise charges added at checkout, including fees associated with tickets, apartment rentals, flights, and other consumer services.

• The plan includes expanding enforcement by the Department of Consumer and Worker Protection to police compliance and pricing transparency.
SEO tags: junk fees, consumer protection, transparency, dcwp, legislation

Headline: Fund $3 Million for Nonprofits Intervening in Con Edison and Other Utility Rate Cases
Short description: Creates a pilot program to fund nonprofit organizations that challenge utility rate cases.
Description:
• The Mamdani administration would create a pilot program with a $3 million cap to fund nonprofit organizations that intervene in utility rate cases before state regulators.

• The program would support intervenors participating in proceedings at the State Public Service Commission, including cases involving Con Edison and other regulated utilities.

• The administration cites nonprofit intervenors as one of the few ways ratepayers can contest proposed utility rate increases.
SEO tags: utility rates, con ed, consumer advocacy, pilot program, funding

Headline: Create the Office Of Deed Theft Prevention
Short description: Establishes a dedicated office to investigate and prevent deed theft and property fraud.
Description:
• Create a new Office of Deed Theft Prevention within the Mayor’s Office to focus on investigating and stopping deed theft and related property fraud.

• The commitment includes allocating $10 million to fund staffing, investigations, and prevention and outreach efforts.

• Resources would be directed toward neighborhoods with higher rates of fraudulent property transfers and homeowners at risk of losing their properties.
SEO tags: deed theft, fraud prevention, homeowners, equity, justice

Headline: Adjust Property Tax Assessments
Short description: Shifts property tax burdens by adjusting assessment percentages to favor outer-borough homeowners.
Description:
• Adjust property tax assessment percentages to shift the burden from outer boroughs to wealthier neighborhoods. 

• The policy effectively lowers tax payments for homeowners in working-class areas while raising them for high-value properties. 

• The Mayor utilizes administrative power to push class assessment percentages down for specific groups.
SEO tags: property tax, tax reform, assessment, equity, homeowners

Headline: Advocate For Tax Circuit Breakers
Short description: Pushes for state "circuit breaker" legislation to cap property taxes based on income.
Description:
• Advocate for state “circuit breaker” legislation that limits property tax payments for eligible homeowners.

• Under a circuit breaker system, property tax bills would be capped at a set percentage of household income.

• The proposal focuses on protecting homeowners with fixed or limited incomes, including seniors and residents in rapidly changing neighborhoods.
SEO tags: property tax, circuit breaker, tax relief, low-income homeowners, albany

Headline: Increase NYC Accelerator Investment
Short description: Boosts funding for the NYC Accelerator to help buildings comply with Local Law 97.
Description:
• Local Law 97 sets emissions limits for large buildings, but many homeowners and building boards struggle to navigate compliance requirements.

• The Mamdani administration wants to turn the NYC Accelerator into a “true one-stop shop” where building owners can get clear guidance on what the law requires and how to comply.

• The expanded Accelerator would centralize technical assistance, planning support, and compliance help so owners do not have to piece together information from multiple agencies or consultants.
SEO tags: local law 97, nyc accelerator, energy efficiency, climate compliance, buildings

Headline: Transform 50 Public Schools Into Community Resilience Hubs
Owner agency: Mayor’s Office of Climate & Environmental Justice, Department of Education
Short description: Converts 50 public schools into community resilience hubs equipped to support residents before, during, and after climate emergencies.
Description:
• The city would establish 50 resilience hubs in New York City public schools, prioritizing low-income communities of color with high exposure to extreme heat, flooding, and power outages.

• The hubs would provide cooling and heating, resilient backup power, internet access, medical supplies, and space for community services, while also operating year-round as centers for training, programming, and social connection.

• The 50 school-based hubs would add to the city’s existing network of 181 library cooling centers, 295 older adult centers, and 17 private facilities, expanding access to cooling centers that are open to New Yorkers of all ages.
SEO tags: resilience hubs, climate adaptation, emergency management, schools, mocej

Headline: Implement Universal, No-Cost Childcare for Children Ages Six Weeks to Five Years
Short description: Establishes universal, no-cost childcare for all children aged six weeks to five years.
Description:
• As candidate, Mayor Zohran Mamdani said the city would provide universal, no-cost childcare for all children ages six weeks to five years, regardless of family income.

• The program would be administered through the city’s education and early childhood system, expanding access to childcare and early learning across neighborhoods.

• Mamdani framed universal childcare as a response to the high cost of living, particularly the role childcare costs play in pushing working families to leave the city.
SEO tags: universal childcare, early education, working families, affordability, doe

Headline: Provide Baby Baskets to All New Families in New York City
Owner agency: Department of Health and Mental Hygiene
Short description: Distributes free "baby baskets" with essential supplies to every new family in NYC.
Description:
• The city would provide every new family in New York City with a free baby basket containing essential supplies such as diapers, wipes, postpartum care items, and resource guides.

• The program is estimated to cost approximately $19 million annually, reflecting citywide distribution to all new families.

• The proposal builds on the Adams administration’s “NYC Baby Boxes” program, which distributes supply boxes at a limited number of public hospitals, and expands the concept into a universal, citywide benefit.

Headline: Renovate 500 Public Schools With Clean Energy and Climate-Resilient Upgrades
Short description: Modernizes 500 public school buildings with clean energy systems and climate-resilient infrastructure upgrades.
Description:
• The administration would renovate 500 public schools with clean energy and climate-resilient building upgrades.

• Planned improvements include renewable energy systems such as rooftop solar, along with upgrades to heating, ventilation, and air conditioning systems.

• The renovations are framed as a way to reduce energy use and emissions while improving indoor air quality and learning environments for students and staff.
SEO tags: green schools, solar, hvac, school renovation, sca

Headline: Convert 500 Asphalt Schoolyards Into Green Community Spaces
Short description: Transforms 500 asphalt schoolyards into green community spaces.
Description:
• The Mamdani administration would convert 500 asphalt schoolyards into green spaces with trees, grass, gardens, and other natural features.

• The conversions are framed as a strategy to reduce extreme heat, manage stormwater, and improve environmental conditions around schools.

• When school is not in session, the green schoolyards would be open to the public and function as neighborhood parks and recreational spaces.
SEO tags: green schoolyards, parks, education, climate resilience, sca

Headline: Enroll Every Public School in Open Streets
Short description: Automatically enrolls every public school in the Open Streets program, which closes streets to car traffic during arrival and dismissal times.
Description:
• The city would automatically enroll every public school in the Open Streets for schools program, replacing the current system that requires schools to apply for participation.

• Open Streets temporarily close streets to most vehicle traffic during school drop-off and pick-up hours, creating safer, cleaner spaces for students, families, and school staff.

• The proposal would increase annual Open Streets funding from about $4 million to $20 million to provide operational support and programming so every school can maintain a car-free street during arrival and dismissal times.
SEO tags: open streets, schools, street safety, dot, pollution

Headline: Launch the 'Community to Classroom' Teacher Recruitment Initiative
Short description: Creates a citywide pipeline that provides tuition support and other benefits in exchange for a three-year teaching commitment in NYC public schools.
Description:
• The initiative provides $12,000 per student per year for tuition, along with OMNY cards, certification exams, and mentorship from current NYC public school teachers.

• The program includes two pathways: an early college track for NYC high school students and a mid-career track for adults such as paraprofessionals and other school community members seeking certification.

• Participants will complete their required three-year teaching commitment in districts with the highest staffing needs, supported by $12 million to fund an annual cohort of 1,000 teachers.

Headline: Create a Tangled Title Fund

Short description: Establishes a $10 million fund to help homeowners clear legal issues with property titles.

• Create a Tangled Title Fund to assist homeowners facing legal barriers tied to unclear or disputed property titles.

• The fund would support efforts to resolve inheritance, estate, and probate complications that prevent families from securing clear ownership of their homes.

• The policy notes that tangled title issues disproportionately affect homeowners in Black and brown communities, where informal property transfers are more common and increase the risk of displacement or fraud.

Headline: Freeze Rents For Stabilized Tenants
Short description: Freeze rents for more than two million New Yorkers living in rent-stabilized apartments.
Description:
• Mayor Mamdani promised to immediately freeze rents for all rent-stabilized tenants.

• Mamdani has the authority to appoint members of the Rent Guidelines Board, who could vote for a rent freeze rather than approve an annual rent increase.

• Under Mayor Eric Adams, Rent Guidelines Board appointees voted to increase rents on stabilized apartments by a cumulative 12.6 percent.

Headline: Construct 200,000 Affordable Homes

Short description: Construct 200,000 new units of publicly subsidized affordable housing over ten years.
Description:
• The city targets construction of 200,000 new units of publicly subsidized, affordable housing over ten years.

• Any 100 percent affordable housing development would be fast-tracked through the city’s land use review process.

• The housing would be built using union labor and consist of permanently affordable, rent-stabilized homes.

Headline: Allocate $70 Billion To Housing Capital Plan
Short description: Increase the City’s housing capital budget by adding $70 billion in new funding to the Ten-Year Capital Plan.
Description:
• The city proposes adding $70 billion in new capital funds to the Ten-Year Capital Plan to support affordable housing production.

• The proposal would bring total planned housing capital investment to $100 billion over ten years.

• The funding would be raised through municipal bonds and requires state approval to increase the city’s debt limit.

Headline: Double NYCHA Capital Investment
Owner agency: New York City Housing Authority, Mayor's Office
Short description: Increase capital funding for major renovations in New York City public housing.
Description:
• Mayor Mamdani committed to doubling its capital investment in major renovations for NYCHA public housing developments.

• The additional funding would be used for large-scale repairs to aging buildings and core infrastructure across the public housing system.

• The plan also includes activating underutilized NYCHA storage areas and parking lots for new affordable housing development.

Headline: Initiate Comprehensive City Plan
Short description: Launches a comprehensive citywide planning process to guide housing growth and development.
Description:
• Mamdani’s team has said that the city has lacked a comprehensive guiding plan for housing development and has relied on fragmented zoning decisions.

• The administration will initiate a Comprehensive City Plan to guide housing development across all five boroughs.

• The proposal frames the planning process as a way to address racially discriminatory zoning legacies and integrate housing decisions with transit and education needs.

Headline: Eliminate Parking Minimums
Short description: Removes requirements for developers to build parking spots in new housing developments.
Description:
• The proposal calls for eliminating parking minimum requirements for new housing developments citywide.

• Parking minimums are zoning rules that require developers to build a set amount of off-street parking as part of new housing projects.

• In an interview, Mamdani said his housing plan includes fully eliminating the parking mandate, arguing that current zoning dedicates excessive public space to parking despite most New Yorkers walking, biking, or using transit.

Headline: Advocate For Universal Rent Stabilization
Short description: Pushes for state legislation to apply rent stabilization rules to all new housing production.
Description:
• Mayor Mamdani commits to advocating for state legislation that would apply rent stabilization rules to all newly constructed housing in New York City.

• Rent stabilization currently applies only to certain buildings, and the proposal would extend regulated lease protections beyond existing programs such as Mandatory Inclusionary Housing.

• Mamdani’s policy proposal frames universal rent stabilization as a way to ensure new housing provides stable, regulated leases rather than market-rate tenancy.
SEO tags: rent stabilization, albany, housing policy, tenant protections, state legislation
Source Text: "Housing By and For New York"; "Promise Tracked"

Headline: Rebuild Office To Protect Tenants
Short description: Restore the city office responsible for tenant advocacy and enforcement after funding cuts under the previous administration.
Description:
• Mayor Mamdani committed to rebuilding the Mayor’s Office to Protect Tenants.

• The office would function as a central coordinating body for tenant advocacy and enforcement actions against landlords.

• The proposal describes the move as reversing prior reductions in funding and institutional priority for tenant protection.

Headline: Streamline Housing Code Enforcement
Short description: Centralizes housing code enforcement from multiple agencies under one coordinated roof.
Description:
• Mayor Mamdani commits to coordinating housing code enforcement agencies through the Mayor’s Office to Protect Tenants.

• Enforcement functions from HPD, DOB, FDNY, DEP, and DOH would be brought together under a single coordinating structure within that office.

• The coordination would cover inspections, data sharing, and enforcement actions against repeat housing code violators.

Headline: Modernize 311 For Tenants
Short description: Upgrade the 311 and launch a website to allow tenants to schedule inspections and track housing violation status
Description:
• A new 311 website portal would allow tenants to schedule housing inspections online.

• Through the portal, tenants could track violation status, receive text reminders for appointments, and view case updates in one place.

• The change responds to gaps in the current system, where inspection scheduling and follow-up lack transparency and predictability.
SEO tags: 311, housing inspections, tenant services, technology, code enforcement

Headline: Increase Fines for Dangerous Living Conditions
Short description: Raises financial penalties on landlords for hazardous and immediately hazardous housing violations.
Description:
• The policy calls for doubling fines for hazardous housing violations, including cracks in walls, broken windows, water damage, roaches, and defective locks.

• It also includes tripling fines for immediately hazardous violations, such as vermin infestations, lack of heat or hot water, and lead paint hazards.

• The policy includes ensuring fines are collected, with the goal of recovering at least $800 million currently owed and generating additional revenue each year.
SEO tags: housing fines, violations, landlords, tenant safety, hpd

Headline: Install Heat Sensors In Buildings
Short description: Classifies failure to maintain indoor temperatures below 78 degrees as a violation.
Description:
• Heat sensors would be installed in residential buildings with repeated heat-related violations to monitor indoor conditions and support enforcement during extreme heat events.

• The Housing Maintenance Code would be updated to classify failure to maintain indoor temperatures below 78 degrees Fahrenheit as a Class C violation when outdoor temperatures reach 82 degrees or higher.

• The update is intended to strengthen enforcement against landlords who fail to maintain safe indoor temperatures as extreme heat becomes more frequent.
SEO tags: extreme heat, housing code, tenant safety, climate adaptation, cooling

Headline: Double Alternative Enforcement Program
Owner agency: Department of Housing Preservation and Development
Short description: Expand city enforcement against repeat-offending landlords by scaling up oversight of the most distressed residential buildings.
Description:
• Mayor Mamdani will double the size of the Alternative Enforcement Program, which places severely distressed apartment buildings under heightened city oversight for chronic housing code violations.

• Buildings in the program are subject to frequent inspections, mandatory repairs, and direct city intervention when owners fail to correct hazardous and immediately hazardous conditions.

• The proposal includes expanding the Office of Special Enforcement, which investigates repeat-offending landlords and supports stronger penalties and accountability measures.
SEO tags: alternative enforcement program, distressed housing, landlords, hpd, repairs

Headline: Restore Funding for Anti-Harassment Tenant Protection Program
Owner agency: Department of Housing Preservation and Development
Short description: Restores funding for legal support that allows tenants to bring harassment cases against landlords.
Description:
• Mayor Mamdani will restore funding to the Anti-Harassment Tenant Protection program, which supports tenants facing harassment or intimidation by their landlords.

• The program provides legal assistance to at-risk tenants pursuing affirmative cases, allowing them to seek relief without fear of retaliation or abuse.

• The restoration reverses $25 million in funding cuts made to the program over the previous three years under Mayor Eric Adams.
SEO tags: tenant harassment, legal services, anti-harassment, hpd, funding

Headline: Fully Fund Neighborhood Pillars
Owner agency: Department of Housing Preservation and Development
Short description: Fully funds the Neighborhood Pillars program to acquire and preserve distressed housing.
Description:
• Fully fund the Neighborhood Pillars program with $1 billion in city capital funding.

• The program finances nonprofit acquisition of distressed rental housing to keep homes permanently affordable.

• The plan targets preserving up to 20,000 homes over ten years, restoring capacity reduced by earlier cuts to housing preservation funding.

Owner agency: Department of Housing Preservation and Development
Short description: Uses the city's emergency repair powers to fix hazards directly and bill the costs to landlords.

Headline: Advocate to Repeal Real Property Tax Law Section 581
Short description: Pushes for state legislation to repeal a tax provision governing how condominiums and cooperatives are assessed.
Description:
• Advocate for state action to repeal Real Property Tax Law Section 581, which requires residential cooperatives and condominiums to be assessed using the income-based method applied to rental buildings.

• Under current law, assessments for condos and co-ops rely on comparable rental income rather than individual unit market values, shaping how these properties are taxed.

• Repeal would require approval by the State Legislature, as assessment rules for these property types are set in state law rather than by the city.
SEO tags: property tax, section 581, condos, co-ops, tax reform

Headline: Extend and Reform J-51 Tax Abatement
Short description: Seek to extend the J-51 tax abatement program and reduce barriers that limit participation.
Description:
• Advocate for extending the J-51 tax abatement program through 2035, allowing landlords to continue accessing tax relief tied to building repairs and capital improvements.

• The proposal also calls for reducing application fees and administrative hurdles that discourage smaller property owners from participating in the program.

• J-51 is framed as a tool to support ongoing building maintenance and repairs, with the extension requiring approval by the State Legislature.
SEO tags: j-51, tax abatement, housing repairs, incentives, albany

Headline: Pass Community Opportunity to Purchase Act (COPA)
Short description: Legislates a right for qualified nonprofits to purchase residential buildings when landlords put them up for sale.
Description:
• The Mamdani administration will work with the City Council to pass the Community Opportunity to Purchase Act, which applies when landlords sell residential multifamily buildings.

• Under COPA, qualified nonprofit buyers are given time to assemble an offer and the ability to match a third-party bid before a sale is finalized.

• The policy is described as being modeled on similar successful legislation in Washington, D.C., and San Francisco.
SEO tags: copa, community land trusts, housing acquisition, anti-displacement, legislation
